trans-unit.source: Getting started with elastic database query
trans-unit.target: Getting started with elastic database query

trans-unit.source: how to use elastic database query
trans-unit.target: how to use elastic database query

trans-unit.source: Getting started with Elastic Database query
trans-unit.target: Getting started with Elastic Database query

trans-unit.source: Elastic Database query (preview) for Azure SQL Database allows you to run T-SQL queries that span multiple databases using a single connection point.
trans-unit.target: Elastic Database query (preview) for Azure SQL Database allows you to run T-SQL queries that span multiple databases using a single connection point.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Elastic Database query feature, please see the [feature overview page](sql-database-elastic-query-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Elastic Database query feature, please see the [feature overview page](sql-database-elastic-query-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: This topic extends the sample found in [Getting started with Elastic Database tools](sql-database-elastic-scale-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: This topic extends the sample found in [Getting started with Elastic Database tools](sql-database-elastic-scale-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: When completed, you will: learn how to configure and use an Azure SQL Database to perform queries that span many related databases.
trans-unit.target: When completed, you will: learn how to configure and use an Azure SQL Database to perform queries that span many related databases.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Download and run the [Getting started with Elastic Database tools sample](sql-database-elastic-scale-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: Download and run the [Getting started with Elastic Database tools sample](sql-database-elastic-scale-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: Create a shard map manager using the sample app
trans-unit.target: Create a shard map manager using the sample app

trans-unit.source: Here you will create a shard map manager along with several shards, followed by insertion of data into the shards.
trans-unit.target: Here you will create a shard map manager along with several shards, followed by insertion of data into the shards.

trans-unit.source: If you happen to already have shards setup with sharded data in them, you can skip the following steps and move to the next section.
trans-unit.target: If you happen to already have shards setup with sharded data in them, you can skip the following steps and move to the next section.

trans-unit.source: Build and run the **Getting started with Elastic Database tools** sample application.
trans-unit.target: Build and run the **Getting started with Elastic Database tools** sample application.

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps until step 7 in the section [Download and run the sample app](sql-database-elastic-scale-get-started.md#Getting-started-with-elastic-database-tools).
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps until step 7 in the section [Download and run the sample app](sql-database-elastic-scale-get-started.md#Getting-started-with-elastic-database-tools).

trans-unit.source: At the end of Step 7, you will see the following command prompt:
trans-unit.target: At the end of Step 7, you will see the following command prompt:

trans-unit.source: ![command prompt][1]
trans-unit.target: ![command prompt][1]

trans-unit.source: In the command window, type "1" and press **Enter**.
trans-unit.target: In the command window, type "1" and press **Enter**.

trans-unit.source: This creates the shard map manager, and adds two shards to the server.
trans-unit.target: This creates the shard map manager, and adds two shards to the server.

trans-unit.source: Then type "3" and press **Enter**; repeat the action four times.
trans-unit.target: Then type "3" and press **Enter**; repeat the action four times.

trans-unit.source: This inserts sample data rows in your shards.
trans-unit.target: This inserts sample data rows in your shards.

trans-unit.source: The [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com) should show three new databases in your v12 server:
trans-unit.target: The [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com) should show three new databases in your v12 server:

trans-unit.source: ![Visual Studio confirmation][2]
trans-unit.target: ![Visual Studio confirmation][2]

trans-unit.source: At this point, cross-database queries are supported through the Elastic Database client libraries.
trans-unit.target: At this point, cross-database queries are supported through the Elastic Database client libraries.

trans-unit.source: For example, use option 4 in the command window.
trans-unit.target: For example, use option 4 in the command window.

trans-unit.source: The results from a multi-shard query are always a **UNION ALL** of the results from all shards.
trans-unit.target: The results from a multi-shard query are always a **UNION ALL** of the results from all shards.

trans-unit.source: In the next section, we create a sample database endpoint that supports richer querying of the data across shards.
trans-unit.target: In the next section, we create a sample database endpoint that supports richer querying of the data across shards.

trans-unit.source: Create an elastic query database
trans-unit.target: Create an elastic query database

trans-unit.source: Open the [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com) and log in.
trans-unit.target: Open the [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com) and log in.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Azure SQL database in the same server as your shard setup.
trans-unit.target: Create a new Azure SQL database in the same server as your shard setup.

trans-unit.source: Name the database "ElasticDBQuery."
trans-unit.target: Name the database "ElasticDBQuery."

trans-unit.source: For a pricing tier, you must select one of the premium offers.
trans-unit.target: For a pricing tier, you must select one of the premium offers.

trans-unit.source: The Elastic Database query is currently available only on the premium tier.
trans-unit.target: The Elastic Database query is currently available only on the premium tier.

trans-unit.source: ![Azure portal and pricing tier][3]
trans-unit.target: ![Azure portal and pricing tier][3]

trans-unit.source: Note: you can use an existing premium database.
trans-unit.target: Note: you can use an existing premium database.

trans-unit.source: If you can do so, it must not be one of the shards that you would like to execute your queries on.
trans-unit.target: If you can do so, it must not be one of the shards that you would like to execute your queries on.

trans-unit.source: This database will be used for creating the metadata objects for an elastic database query.
trans-unit.target: This database will be used for creating the metadata objects for an elastic database query.

trans-unit.source: Create database objects
trans-unit.target: Create database objects

trans-unit.source: Database-scoped master key and credentials
trans-unit.target: Database-scoped master key and credentials

trans-unit.source: These are used to connect to the shard map manager and the shards:
trans-unit.target: These are used to connect to the shard map manager and the shards:

trans-unit.source: Open SQL Server Management Studio or SQL Server Data Tools in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Open SQL Server Management Studio or SQL Server Data Tools in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Connect to ElasticDBQuery database and execute the following T-SQL commands:
trans-unit.target: Connect to ElasticDBQuery database and execute the following T-SQL commands:

trans-unit.source: "username" and "password" should be the same as login information used in step 6 of [Download and run the sample app](sql-database-elastic-scale-get-started.md#Getting-started-with-elastic-database-tools) in [Getting started with elastic database tools](sql-database-elastic-scale-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: "username" and "password" should be the same as login information used in step 6 of [Download and run the sample app](sql-database-elastic-scale-get-started.md#Getting-started-with-elastic-database-tools) in [Getting started with elastic database tools](sql-database-elastic-scale-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: External data sources
trans-unit.target: External data sources

trans-unit.source: To create an external data source, execute the following command on the ElasticDBQuery database:
trans-unit.target: To create an external data source, execute the following command on the ElasticDBQuery database:

trans-unit.source: "CustomerIDShardMap" is the name of the shard map, if you created the shard map and shard map manager using the elastic database tools sample.
trans-unit.target: "CustomerIDShardMap" is the name of the shard map, if you created the shard map and shard map manager using the elastic database tools sample.

trans-unit.source: However, if you used your custom setup for this sample, then it should be the shard map name you chose in your application.
trans-unit.target: However, if you used your custom setup for this sample, then it should be the shard map name you chose in your application.

trans-unit.source: External tables
trans-unit.target: External tables

trans-unit.source: Create an external table that matches the Customers table on the shards by executing the following command on ElasticDBQuery database:
trans-unit.target: Create an external table that matches the Customers table on the shards by executing the following command on ElasticDBQuery database:

trans-unit.source: Execute a sample elastic database T-SQL query
trans-unit.target: Execute a sample elastic database T-SQL query

trans-unit.source: Once you have defined your external data source and your external tables you can now use full T-SQL over your external tables.
trans-unit.target: Once you have defined your external data source and your external tables you can now use full T-SQL over your external tables.

trans-unit.source: Execute this query on the ElasticDBQuery database:
trans-unit.target: Execute this query on the ElasticDBQuery database:

trans-unit.source: You will notice that the query aggregates results from all the shards and gives the following output:
trans-unit.target: You will notice that the query aggregates results from all the shards and gives the following output:

trans-unit.source: ![Output details][4]
trans-unit.target: ![Output details][4]

trans-unit.source: Import elastic database query results to Excel
trans-unit.target: Import elastic database query results to Excel

trans-unit.source: You can import the results from of a query to an Excel file.
trans-unit.target: You can import the results from of a query to an Excel file.

trans-unit.source: Launch Excel 2013.
trans-unit.target: Launch Excel 2013.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the **Data** ribbon.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the **Data** ribbon.

trans-unit.source: Click **From Other Sources** and click **From SQL Server**.
trans-unit.target: Click **From Other Sources** and click **From SQL Server**.

trans-unit.source: ![Excel import from other sources][5]
trans-unit.target: ![Excel import from other sources][5]

trans-unit.source: In the **Data Connection Wizard** type the server name and login credentials.
trans-unit.target: In the **Data Connection Wizard** type the server name and login credentials.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: In the dialog box **Select the database that contains the data you want**, select the **ElasticDBQuery** database.
trans-unit.target: In the dialog box **Select the database that contains the data you want**, select the **ElasticDBQuery** database.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Customers** table in the list view and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Customers** table in the list view and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Import Data** form, under **Select how you want to view this data in your workbook**, select **Table** and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Import Data** form, under **Select how you want to view this data in your workbook**, select **Table** and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: All the rows from **Customers** table, stored in different shards populate the Excel sheet.
trans-unit.target: All the rows from **Customers** table, stored in different shards populate the Excel sheet.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: You can now use Excel’s powerful data functions.
trans-unit.target: You can now use Excel’s powerful data functions.

trans-unit.source: You can use the connection string with your server name, database name and credentials to connect your BI and data integration tools to the elastic query database.
trans-unit.target: You can use the connection string with your server name, database name and credentials to connect your BI and data integration tools to the elastic query database.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that SQL Server is supported as a data source for your tool.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that SQL Server is supported as a data source for your tool.

trans-unit.source: You can refer to the elastic query database and external tables just like any other SQL Server database and SQL Server tables that you would connect to with your tool.
trans-unit.target: You can refer to the elastic query database and external tables just like any other SQL Server database and SQL Server tables that you would connect to with your tool.

trans-unit.source: Cost
trans-unit.target: Cost

trans-unit.source: There is no additional charge for using the Elastic Database Query feature.
trans-unit.target: There is no additional charge for using the Elastic Database Query feature.

trans-unit.source: However, at this time this feature is available only on premium databases as an end point, but the shards can be of any service tier.
trans-unit.target: However, at this time this feature is available only on premium databases as an end point, but the shards can be of any service tier.

trans-unit.source: For pricing information see [SQL Database Pricing Details](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/sql-database/).
trans-unit.target: For pricing information see [SQL Database Pricing Details](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/sql-database/).
